channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024071894
item.description:
Report X-2024071894

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was found while loading a delivery truck. It was brought to repacks. It was put into a plastic hazmat bag and hazmat drum and brought to the hazmat cage and put under the vent. The area where the liquid came out was not apparent. The cap was tight, and it didn't leak from there. The spill was at the bottom of the shipping box, and you can see the ring from the bottom of the container. But no apparent seam split or hole. There was an indent in the container, but it was toward the top of the container. But there was liquid in the plastic bag that the container was in with a zip tie.

item.title: Report X-2024071951
item.description:
Report X-2024071951

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE BROWN BELT A LOADER APPROACHED AND TOLD RESPONDER HE HAD A HAZMAT LEAKER. THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN LOADED ON TO THE SHELF AND A SMALL PUDDLE WAS NOTICABLE BEHIND IT. RECOGNIZING THE CLASS 3 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL RESPONDER CHECKED THE DECISION TREE, AND WEARING PROPER PPE, CONTAINED THE PACKAGE. AFTER WIPING UP THE SPILL RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024071312
item.description:
Report X-2024071312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was brought to QA for inspection due to leaking box. Upon inspection package was improperly packed; contents were found inside of a hazmat bag leaking. All four bottles of Xylene have leaked through its seals and caps. One of them had a dented top allowing its contents to leak.

item.title: Report I-2024070042
item.description:
Report I-2024070042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: Tacoma
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: TOTE MARITIME ALASKA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 18,2024, TAG inspected trailer V 530005, booking SEA 1033894. This load is scheduled for NB on the Midnight Sun voyage 24097 that departs Tacoma on 6/19/2024. Upon inspecting it, TAG found undeclared hazardous items of 2 boxes of UN 1266 Perfumery Products, Class 3 Flammable marked as Limited Quantity. These items were not submitted for approval and the trailer in gated to the terminal staged to load as a non-hazardous trailer.
